definition: to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
liver/CL:葉|叶[ye4],個|个[ge4]
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: He wanted to have a "heart to heart" talk with this youth .
sentences.chinese: 他想跟這個年輕人“肝膽相照”地談一談。

sentences.english: China and Cambodia are devoted friends.
sentences.chinese: 中國和柬埔寨是肝膽相照的好朋友。

sentences.english: You have followed me for a long time, you're so good to me.
sentences.chinese: 你跟了我這麼久，對我有情有義，肝膽相照。

definition: variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
magnanimous
dazed/confused/fuddled
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
respect for the wise
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
